item.title: Ticket #38843 (Add filter for post statuses in _update_post_term_count()) updated
item.dc:creator: nwjames
item.description:
Sorry my comment with the modified diff was a little cryptic.

The SQL statement is rather long and contained 2 occurrences of "= 'publish'" (one for posts and the other for attachments).

The previous fix addressed only the first one.

item.title: 38843-1.diff attached to Ticket #38843

item.description: Modified the SQL to change the second occurence of "= 'publish

item.title: Ticket #52086 (user-profile.min.js issue on Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: cbigler
item.description:
Replying to brookedot:

I think the next step here is to see if we can get steps to reproduce the problem with as vanilla of setup as possible. For example, with just core plugin and themes. I've seen this happen twice now across sites but never been able to narrow down the root cause. Once we have a way to reproduce we can take a look into a fix for 5.6.1.

Agreed, and should anyone stumble across this and their website uses Smart Sections for WPBakery ... their team was very responsive ... much appreciated!

item.title: Ticket #51854 (Add more contrast on input borders during installation) closed
item.dc:creator: SergeyBiryukov
item.description:
fixed:

In 49907:

Accessibility: Upgrade/Install: Add more contrast to input borders during installation.

This brings the accessibility improvements previously made for other areas of the admin in WordPress 5.3 to the installation screens too.

Follow-up to [46241-46244], [46247], [46248], [46293], [46425].

Props Maigret, audrasjb.
Fixes #51854.

item.title: Ticket #52178 (Allowed memory size exhausted / url creates new post entry?) created
item.dc:creator: sgatz
item.description:
We get repeated bots (across multiple WP sites) hitting a specific URL pattern, they append a query string onto the end of a wordpress URL like this:

https://www.example.com/permalink-to-article?q=user%2Fpassword&name%5B%23markup%5D=id&name%5B%23type%5D=markup&name%5B%23post_render%5D%5B%5D=passthru

This causes a memory exhausted error here:
/wp/wp-includes/post.php at line 773: 

} elseif ( is_object( $post ) ) {
		if ( empty( $post->filter ) ) {
			$_post = sanitize_post( $post, 'raw' );
			$_post = new WP_Post( $_post );    ##<--- HERE
		} elseif ( 'raw' === $post->filter ) {
			$_post = new WP_Post( $post );
		} else {

item.title: Website Edge OK.png attached to Ticket #52177

item.title: Ticket #52177 (After wordpress 5.6 update Firefox not showing all background pictures ...) created
item.dc:creator: zskeresztes
item.description:
Hello,

After I updated my Webpage to WordPress 5.6 my site is working my with all Browsers (Edge, Chrome, etc.) but not working with Firefox Desktop.
Firefox is now not showing all background pictures of my subsite.
When I press Ctrl+Shift+K to check the reason the pictures are appearing automatically.
Normally it should be appearing automatically in the same way as it is happing with other Browsers.
Here is an example of one of the subsites ​https://www.advilcom.ro/en/despre-noi/, It should be a picture in the area where the big About Us text is writen in the middle of the page.

Can you help me how to solve this problem ?

Thank you!

Best regards,
Zsolt

item.title: Ticket #52176 (Twenty Twenty-One: style.css has errors in PhpStorm IDE) created
item.dc:creator: mukesh27
item.description:
Hi, just upgraded to WP 5.6 with TwentyTwentyOne theme. The application itself seems to work fine. But when I open it with my PhpStorm IDE, the style.css file shows many errors. Most are related to many -- variables are not defined. But below caught my attention the most:

@media only screen and (min-width: 482px) {
	.primary-navigation > div > .menu-wrapper li {
		margin: 0;
		width: inherit;
	}
	.primary-navigation > div > .menu-wrapper li:last-child() {
		margin-right: 0;
	}
}

The IDE highlight last-child() as error. Why do we need a parenthesis here?

Original support ticket - ​https://wordpress.org/support/topic/twentytwentyone-theme-style-css-has-errors/

Props to @activecoder

item.title: Ticket #52086 (user-profile.min.js issue on Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: brookedot
item.description: I think the next step here is to see if we can get steps to reproduce the problem with as vanilla of setup as possible. For example, with just core plugin and themes. I've seen this happen twice now across sites but never been able to narrow down the root cause. Once we have a way to reproduce we can take a look into a fix for 5.6.1.

item.title: Ticket #52086 (user-profile.min.js issue on Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: cbigler
item.description:
Update for my particular issue / environment ...

Issues surrounding this involved jQuery Manager plugin not just Smart Sections, so playing with the settings alleviated the problem with Firefox.

In particular, a Smart Sections plugin update helped, and I wasn't running jQuery Migrate, so I enabled that.

item.title: Ticket #52086 (user-profile.min.js issue on Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: cbigler
item.description:
Replying to cbigler:

Same problem here ... Firefox 84 doesn't work, but Chrome does (Win 10). I tried the edit on user-profile.js mentioned in post https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/52086#comment:1 from @adi64bit ... still doesn't work.

For me, the issue is resolved by deactivating a plugin named Smart Sections at ​https://codecanyon.net/item/smart-sections-wpbakery-page-builder-formerly-visual-composer-addon/21641422 which I use extensively ... I'll alert them to this.

item.title: Ticket #52086 (user-profile.min.js issue on Firefox) updated
item.dc:creator: cbigler
item.description: Same problem here ... Firefox 84 doesn't work, but Chrome does (Win 10). I tried the edit on user-profile.js mentioned in post https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/52086#comment:1 from @adi64bit ... still doesn't work.
